pr_title: xds: add more route matching types in converted Route data structure

timeline.message: Implement Envoy proto message converters, with validation logics embedded.
Clean up route validation logic in XdsClient, it's done alone with the conversion.
Fix tests for the xDS resolver for the new invariants of converted data.
Clean up route data conversion and add test coverage.
Add document to specify the idea of converting Envoy's proto message to Java objects.

timeline.bodyText: Justification: a valid Route should always have a valid matcher and a valid action.
timeline.author: voidzcy

timeline.bodyText: Justification: use null for unset values as in proto only one of prefix, path, regex can be set. It is ambiguous for converted objects to use "" for unset fields given that "" itself can be a set value.
timeline.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: "" is ambiguous anyway. If someone sets a nonempty value and then sets it to empty value, they probably mean to unset it.
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: That's why I changed to use null if the corresponding filed in the proto is unset.
replies.author: voidzcy

replies.bodyText: Sorry I replied to the wrong thread, I thought this was a comment about the environment variable in another PR
replies.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Ok, for that. You do not need to consider that much. Out implementation should be based on normal usage and is not intended to be failsafe in terms of undocumented usage.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.message: Increase coverage by adding more tests for data conversions.

timeline.author: dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Done. Not a big issue, I may use that pattern previously somewhere else. But I changed to "]: " as you prefer for changes made in this PR.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.bodyText: Comment not necessary. The code explains itself. For google java style, this special comment is not required in the last statement group of the switch block.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: It shouldn't.  The above is the only case for default matcher. It's not practical to check if a regex can match all.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: Seems headerMatchers is never null. It's not a oneof element.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0
dapengzhang0

replies.bodyText: Done. You are right, I miss interpreted your previous code.
replies.author: voidzcy

timeline.bodyText: "" in path is not default. It's not valid.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0
dapengzhang0
dapengzhang0

timeline.bodyText: Might better to disable stacktrace which causes a lot of memory allocation.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.message: Add re2j dependency to grpc-xds for path/header matching.
Safe regex should be verified by compiling it during data conversion.
Disable unnecessary stacktrace and suppresion info for InvalidProtoDataException, as it's used internally.

timeline.bodyText: Equal objects must have equal hashCode.
timeline.author: dapengzhang0

timeline.message: Fix hashCode for equal HeaderMatcher object.
